blocks.text:
It will be seen that such a volume can be measured by the equation 

$V = \int y \, dx$ , the volume 

$V = \sqrt{y}$ , which is the standard form for an area. Hence, if 
values of $y$ are given, corresponding values of $x$ must be cal- 
culated and plotted as ordinates, and the area of the resulting 
figure found.

It should be noted that $\sqrt{y}$ might be written as $\sqrt{\frac{y}{x}}$ , thus saving labour by resolving the numerator by $n$ until the 

$

$ .

blocks.caption: Volume of Solid of Revolution
blocks.description: This figure illustrates the method for calculating the volume of a solid generated by revolving a shape around an axis. The curves and the resulting 3D shape help demonstrate how the area under the curve translates into volume.

blocks.text: Example 12. â€” The curve given by the figures in the table revolves about the axis of $x$ ; the values of $y$ and those of $x$ are plotted as ordinates.
